snippet: A seventh-century gospel discovered in a saint’s coffin more than 900 years ago, and the oldest European book to survive fully intact, has been acquired by the British Library for $14 million.
abstract: British Library acquires manuscript copy of the Gospel of John, called the St Cuthbert Gospel, for $14 million; gospel is the oldest European book to survive fully intact.
lead_paragraph: A seventh-century gospel discovered in a saint’s coffin more than 900 years ago, and the oldest European book to survive fully intact, has been acquired by the British Library for $14 million.
